security: This document contains the personal views and associations of an individual, Manuel Marti, regarding communism and his allegiance to the United States. Releasing this information could potentially violate his privacy and expose his personal beliefs and affiliations, which could be used against him or his family. Disclosing the identity of the interrogators and witnesses also poses a potential security risk.
summary: Manuel Marti provides a sworn statement to US Army Intelligence regarding his views on communism, his associations, and his allegiance to the United States, stating he is against communism, has no communist affiliations, and supports the US Constitution.
summary_one_paragraph: On March 26, 1969, in An Khe, Republic of Vietnam, Manuel Marti provided a sworn statement to Special Agents Donald M. Miyoshi and William L. Brooks of the 55th MI Detachment regarding allegations of his association with possible members of the Communist Party. Marti stated under oath that he is against communism, has never participated in communist activities, and does not knowingly associate with members of the communist party. He affirmed his support for the United States Constitution and his allegiance to the United States, concluding that he had nothing further to add to the statement.
title: Statement by Accused or Suspected Person
